quest.name: Enemy Mine
journal: Auphiliot is worried about Buscarron in light of recent events.

Buscarron is vexed by the appearance of Garleans in the Twelveswood. To ease his mind, Auphiliot would have you speak with a Coeurlclaw poacher and a flyer for the Redbelly Wasps, and ask that they keep an eye out for any Garleans they might spy.
You have asked for the vigilant eyes of both poachers and Wasps alike. Take word of your deeds back to Auphiliot at Buscarron's Druthers.

It turns out that Auphiliot had more in mind than assuring Buscarron that the Garleans are being kept in check. He also had you meet the poacher and the flyer so that they would know who you are, and that you do not fear them. He hopes such meetings will serve to make you ever more useful to the proprietor and clientele of Buscarron's Druthers.
objectives: Speak with a flyer for the Redbelly Wasps.

dialogue.name: AUPHILIOT
dialogue.text: Yer word o' Garleans in the wood's got ol' Buscarron beside himself with worry.

dialogue.name: AUPHILIOT
dialogue.text: So, I came up with a bit of an idea, I did. Might be ye heard, there's a place near to here where poachers an' all other manner o' scum gather.

dialogue.name: AUPHILIOT
dialogue.text: They're no friends o' Gridania, to be sure, but they've even less love for Garlemald. So I got to thinkin', why not ask 'em to keep an eye on any Garleans in the wood? Enemy o' my enemy, an' all that.

dialogue.name: MITSURYO
dialogue.text: Buscarron is worried by Garleans in the wood, is he? Then the situation must be dire. Very well, I will see to it any imperials are watched with a close eye.

dialogue.name: MITSURYO
dialogue.text: By the by, you are the [Race] making a name for herhimself of late, are you not? It is good to finally put a face to the name.

dialogue.name: READBERRY
dialogue.text: Garleans in the wood? Buscarron would not lie of such things. Nor, I think, would you. Worry not─the Wasps are watching.

dialogue.name: READBERRY
dialogue.text: Tell me, are you the [Job] rumors speak of? Aye, I suspected as much.

dialogue.name: READBERRY
dialogue.text: Many Wasps are looking forward to the day they cross paths with you─myself included. Until then, friend.

dialogue.name: AUPHILIOT
dialogue.text: So, how's the hospitality of our enemies? Left a sour taste in yer mouth, did it? Pity, that.

dialogue.name: AUPHILIOT
dialogue.text: They've no respect for land or law, but they're not without their uses. Now they know who ye are, an' that ye ain't scared of 'em.

dialogue.name: AUPHILIOT
dialogue.text: Yer name's gettin' known o' late, for better or worse. Lotta folk takin' an interest in ye.

dialogue.name: AUPHILIOT
dialogue.text: Thought it best if ye went lookin' for 'em before they came lookin' for you.
